questions.question: Which of the following is NOT considered a body plane?
questions.explanation: The oblique plane is not a standard anatomical plane. The standard planes are sagittal (divides left-right), coronal/frontal (divides anterior-posterior), and transverse/horizontal (divides superior-inferior).
hints: Think about the three main anatomical planes

questions.question: What anatomical term describes a structure closer to the point of attachment?
questions.explanation: Proximal means closer to the point of attachment or origin. For example, the elbow is proximal to the wrist.

questions.question: The dorsal body cavity contains which of the following?
questions.explanation: The dorsal body cavity contains the cranial cavity (brain) and vertebral canal (spinal cord). The ventral cavity contains thoracic and abdominopelvic cavities.

metadata.description: Basic anatomical terminology, body planes, and cavities
